apiClassifier.shortdesc: The SelectionManager class manages text selection in a text flow.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc:
The SelectionManager class manages text selection in a text flow.
The selection manager keeps track of the selected text range, manages its formatting, and can handle events affecting the selection. To allow a user to make selections in a text flow, assign a SelectionManager object to the interactionManager property of the flow. (To allow editing, assign an instance of the EditManager class, which extends SelectionManager.)
The following table describes how the SelectionManager class handles keyboard shortcuts:
TB,LTRTB,RTLTL,LTRRL,RTL
nonectrlalt|ctrl+altnonectrlalt|ctrl+altnonectrlalt|ctrl+altnonectrlalt|ctrl+alt
leftarrowpreviousCharacterpreviousWordpreviousWordnextCharacternextWordnextWordnextLineendOfDocumentendOfParagraphnextLineendOfDocumentendOfParagraph
uparrowpreviousLinestartOfDocumentstartOfParagraphpreviousLinestartOfDocumentstartOfParagraphpreviousCharacterpreviousWordpreviousWordnextCharacternextWordnextWord
rightarrownextCharacternextWordnextWordpreviousCharacterpreviousWordpreviousWordpreviousLinestartOfDocumentstartOfParagraphpreviousLinestartOfDocumentstartOfParagraph
downarrownextLineendOfDocumentendOfParagraphnextLineendOfDocumentendOfParagraphnextCharacternextWordnextWordpreviousCharacterpreviousWordpreviousWord
homestartOfLinestartOfDocumentstartOfLinestartOfLinestartOfDocumentstartOfLinestartOfLinestartOfDocumentstartOfLinestartOfLinestartOfDocumentstartOfLine
endendOfLineendOfDocumentendOfLineendOfLineendOfDocumentendOfLineendOfLineendOfDocumentendOfLineendOfLineendOfDocumentendOfLine
pagedownnextPagenextPagenextPagenextPagenextPagenextPagenextPagenextPagenextPagenextPagenextPagenextPage
pageuppreviousPagepreviousPagepreviousPagepreviousPagepreviousPagepreviousPagepreviousPagepreviousPagepreviousPagepreviousPagepreviousPagepreviousPage
Key:
none = no modifier
ctrl, shift, alt = modifiers
alt-key and ctrl+alt-key are the same on all platforms (on some platforms alt-key does not get to TLF)
shift key modifes to extend the active end of the selection in the specified manner
TB (top-to-bottom),RL (right-to-left) are textFlow level blockProgression settings
LTR (left-to-right),RTL (right-to-left) are textFlow level direction settings
next and prev in logical order in the textFlow - the effect in RTL text is that the selection moves in the physical direction

apiConstructorDetail.apiDesc:
Creates a SelectionManager object.
Assign a SelectionManager object to the interactionManager property of a text flow to enable text selection.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Perform a SelectionManager operation - these may never modify the flow but clients still are able to cancel them.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Perform a SelectionManager operation - these may never modify the flow but clients still are able to cancel them.

apiParam.apiDesc: The optional range of text for which common attributes are requested. If null, the current selection is used.
The optional range of text for which common attributes are requested. If null, the current selection is used.
The optional range of text for which common attributes are requested. If null, the current selection is used.
The point in the text where the change was made.
A positive or negative number indicating how many characters were inserted or deleted.

apiValue.shortdesc: The format that will be applied to inserted text.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc:
The format that will be applied to inserted text.
TBD: pointFormat needs to be extended to remember user styles and "undefine" of formats from calls to IEditManager.undefineFormat with leafFormat values on a point selection.

apiValue.shortdesc: The TextFlow object managed by this selection manager.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc:
The TextFlow object managed by this selection manager.
A selection manager manages a single text flow. A selection manager can also be assigned to a text flow by setting the interactionManager property of the TextFlow object.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: The TextScrap class represents a fragment of a text flow.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc:
The TextScrap class represents a fragment of a text flow.
A TextScrap is a holding place for all or part of a TextFlow. A range of text can be copied from a TextFlow into a TextScrap, and pasted from the TextScrap into another TextFlow.

apiParam.apiDesc: if set, the new TextScrap object contains the entire text flow. Otherwise, the TextScrap object is empty.

apiConstructorDetail.apiDesc:
Creates a TextScrap object.
Use the createTextScrap() method to create a TextScrap object from a range of text represented by a TextRange object.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Creates a duplicate copy of this TextScrap object.

apiReturn.apiDesc: TextScrap A copy of this TextScrap.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Creates a duplicate copy of this TextScrap object.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Creates a TextScrap object from a range of text represented by a TextRange object.

apiParam.apiDesc: the TextRange object representing the range of text to copy.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Creates a TextScrap object from a range of text represented by a TextRange object.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: The ElementRange class represents the range of objects selected within a text flow.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc:
The ElementRange class represents the range of objects selected within a text flow.
The beginning elements (such as firstLeaf) are always less than or equal to the end elements (in this case, lastLeaf) for each pair of values in an element range.

apiParam.apiDesc: the text flow
absolute text position of the first character in the text range
one beyond the absolute text position of the last character in the text range

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Creates an ElementRange object.

apiValue.shortdesc: The absolute text position of the FlowLeafElement object that contains the end of the range.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The absolute text position of the FlowLeafElement object that contains the end of the range.

apiValue.shortdesc: The absolute text position of the FlowLeafElement object that contains the start of the range.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The absolute text position of the FlowLeafElement object that contains the start of the range.

apiValue.shortdesc: The format attributes of the characters in the range.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc:
The format attributes of the characters in the range.
If the range spans more than one FlowElement object, which means that more than one character format may exist within the range, the format of the first FlowElement object is returned.

apiValue.shortdesc: The format attributes of the container displaying the range.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc:
The format attributes of the container displaying the range.
If the range spans more than one container, the format of the first container is returned.

apiValue.shortdesc: The FlowLeafElement object that contains the start of the range.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The FlowLeafElement object that contains the start of the range.

apiValue.shortdesc: The ParagraphElement object that contains the start of the range.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The ParagraphElement object that contains the start of the range.

apiValue.shortdesc: The FlowLeafElement object that contains the end of the range.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The FlowLeafElement object that contains the end of the range.

apiValue.shortdesc: The ParagraphElement object that contains the end of the range.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The ParagraphElement object that contains the end of the range.

apiValue.shortdesc: The format attributes of the paragraph containing the range.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc:
The format attributes of the paragraph containing the range.
If the range spans more than one paragraph, the format of the first paragraph is returned.

apiValue.shortdesc: The TextFlow object that contains the range.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The TextFlow object that contains the range.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: The SelectionState class represents a selection in a text flow.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc:
The SelectionState class represents a selection in a text flow.
A selection range has an anchor point, representing the point at which the selection of text began, and an active point, representing the point to which the selection is extended. The active point can be before or after the anchor point in the text. If a selection is modified (for example, by a user shift-clicking with the mouse), the active point changes while the anchor point always remains in the same position.

apiParam.apiDesc: The TextFlow associated with the selection.
The anchor index of the selection.
The active index of the selection.
The TextLayoutFormat to be applied on next character typed when a point selection

apiConstructorDetail.apiDesc:
Creates a SelectionState object.
Note: Do not construct a SelectionState object in order to create a selection. To create a selection in a text flow, call the setSelection() method of the relevant ISelectionManager instance (which is the SelectionManager or EditManager object assigned to the interactionManager property of the text flow).

apiOperation.shortdesc: Updates the selection range with new anchor or active position values.

apiParam.apiDesc: the anchor index of the selection.
the active index of the selection.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Updates the selection range with new anchor or active position values.
The pointFormat styles are cleared if the selection is changed.

apiValue.shortdesc: The format attributes applied to inserted text.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc:
The format attributes applied to inserted text.
Note: The pointFormat object does not include inherited styles. To get all the applicable style definitions, use the getCommonCharacterFormats() method of the ISelectionManager class.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: IEditManager defines the interface for handling edit operations of a text flow.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc:
IEditManager defines the interface for handling edit operations of a text flow.
To enable text flow editing, assign an IEditManager instance to the interactionManager property of the TextFlow object. The edit manager handles changes to the text (such as insertions, deletions, and format changes). Changes are reversible if the edit manager has an undo manager. The edit manager triggers the recomposition and display of the text flow, as necessary.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Applies container styles to any containers in the selection.

apiParam.apiDesc: the format to apply to the containers in the range
specifies the text to which this operation applies; if null, the operation applies to the current selection.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Applies container styles to any containers in the selection.
Any style properties in the format object that are null are left unchanged.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Applies styles to the specified element.

apiParam.apiDesc: the element to which the styles are applied.
the format containing the styles to apply
specifies the text to which this operation applies; if null, the operation applies to the current selection.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Applies styles to the specified element.
Any style properties in the format object that are null are left unchanged. Only styles that are relevant to the specified element are applied.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Changes the formats of the specified (or current) selection.

apiParam.apiDesc: the format to apply to leaf elements such as spans and inline graphics
format to apply to paragraph elements
format to apply to the containers
specifies the text to which this operation applies; if null, the operation applies to the current selection.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Changes the formats of the specified (or current) selection.
Executes an undoable operation that applies the new formats. Only style attributes set for the TextLayoutFormat objects are applied. Undefined attributes in the format objects are not changed.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Changes the format applied to the leaf elements in the specified (or current) selection.

apiParam.apiDesc: the format to apply.
specifies the text to which this operation applies; if null, the operation applies to the current selection.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Changes the format applied to the leaf elements in the specified (or current) selection.
Executes an undoable operation that applies the new format to leaf elements such as SpanElement and InlineGraphicElement objects. Only style attributes set for the TextLayoutFormat objects are applied. Undefined attributes in the format object are changed.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Transforms a selection into a link, or a link into normal text.

apiParam.apiDesc: The uri referenced by the link.
The target browser window of the link.
Specifies whether to consolidate selection with any overlapping existing links, and then apply the change.
specifies the text to which this operation applies; if null, the operation applies to the current selection.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Transforms a selection into a link, or a link into normal text.
Executes an undoable operation that creates or removes the link.
If a target parameter is specified, it must be one of the following values:
"_self"
"_blank"
"_parent"
"_top"
In browser-hosted runtimes, a target of "_self" replaces the current html page. So, if the SWF content containing the link is in a page within a frame or frameset, the linked content loads within that frame. If the page is at the top level, the linked content opens to replace the original page. A target of "_blank" opens a new browser window with no name. A target of "_parent" replaces the parent of the html page containing the SWF content. A target of "_top" replaces the top-level page in the current browser window.
In other runtimes, such as Adobe AIR, the link opens in the user's default browser and the target parameter is ignored.
The extendToLinkBoundary parameter determines how the edit manager treats a selection that intersects with one or more existing links. If the parameter is true, then the operation is applied as a unit to the selection and the whole text of the existing links. Thus, a single link is created that spans from the beginning of the first link intersected to the end of the last link intersected. In contrast, if extendToLinkBoundary were false in this situation, the existing partially selected links would be split into two links.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Applies paragraph styles to any paragraphs in the selection.

apiParam.apiDesc: the format to apply to the selected paragraphs.
specifies the text to which this operation applies; if null, the operation applies to the current selection.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Applies paragraph styles to any paragraphs in the selection.
Any style properties in the format object that are null are left unchanged.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Transforms text into a TCY run, or a TCY run into non-TCY text.

apiParam.apiDesc: specify true to apply TCY to a text range, false to remove TCY.
specifies the text to which this operation applies; if null, the operation applies to the current selection.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Transforms text into a TCY run, or a TCY run into non-TCY text.
TCY, or tate-chu-yoko, causes text to draw horizontally within a vertical line, and is used to make small blocks of non-Japanese text or numbers, such as dates, more readable in vertical text.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Begins a new group of operations.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Begins a new group of operations.
All operations executed after the call to beginCompositeOperation(), and before the matching call to endCompositeOperation() are executed and grouped together as a single operation that can be undone as a unit.
A beginCompositeOperation/endCompositeOperation block can be nested inside another beginCompositeOperation/endCompositeOperation block.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Changes the ID of an element.

apiParam.apiDesc: the new ID value
the element to modify
an offset from the beginning of the element at which to split the element when assigning the new ID
an offset from the end of the element at which to split the element when assigning the new ID
specifies the selection to restore when undoing this operation; if null, the operation saves the current selection.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Changes the ID of an element.
If the relativeStart or relativeEnd parameters are set (to anything other than the default values), then the element is split. The parts of the element outside this range retain the original ID. Setting both the relativeStart and relativeEnd parameters creates elements with duplicate IDs.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Changes the styleName of an element or part of an element.

apiParam.apiDesc: the name of the new style.
specifies the element to change.
an offset from the beginning of the element at which to split the element when assigning the new style
an offset from the end of the element at which to split the element when assigning the new style
specifies the selection to restore when undoing this operation; if null, the operation saves the current selection.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Changes the styleName of an element or part of an element.
If the relativeStart or relativeEnd parameters are set (to anything other than the default values), then the element is split. The parts of the element outside this range retain the original style.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Undefines styles to the specified element.

apiParam.apiDesc: the element to which the styles are applied.
the format containing the styles to undefine
specifies the text to which this operation applies; if null, the operation applies to the current selection.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Undefines styles to the specified element.
Any style properties in the format object that are undefined are left unchanged. Any styles that are defined in the specififed format are undefined on the specified element.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Undefines formats of the specified (or current) selection.

apiParam.apiDesc: The format whose set values indicate properties to undefine to LeafFlowElement objects in the selected range.
The format whose set values indicate properties to undefine to ParagraphElement objects in the selected range.
The format whose set values indicate properties to undefine to ContainerController objects in the selected range.
specifies the text to which this operation applies; if null, the operation applies to the current selection.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Undefines formats of the specified (or current) selection.
Executes an undoable operation that undefines the specified formats. Only style attributes set for the TextLayoutFormat objects are applied. Undefined attributes in the format objects are not changed.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Deletes the selected area and returns the deleted area in a TextScrap object.

apiParam.apiDesc: specifies the text to which this operation applies; if null, the operation applies to the current selection.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Deletes the selected area and returns the deleted area in a TextScrap object.
The resulting TextScrap can be posted to the system clipboard or used in a subsequent pasteTextOperation() operation.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Deletes a range of text, or, if a point selection is given, deletes the next character.

apiParam.apiDesc: specifies the text to which this operation applies; if null, the operation applies to the current selection.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Deletes a range of text, or, if a point selection is given, deletes the next character.

apiParam.apiDesc: specifies the text to which this operation applies; if null, the operation applies to the current selection.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Deletes the next word.
If a range is selected, the first word of the range is deleted.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Deletes a range of text, or, if a point selection is given, deletes the previous character.

apiParam.apiDesc: specifies the text to which this operation applies; if null, the operation applies to the current selection.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Deletes a range of text, or, if a point selection is given, deletes the previous character.

apiParam.apiDesc: specifies the text to which this operation applies; if null, the operation applies to the current selection.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Deletes the previous word.
If a range is selected, the first word of the range is deleted.

apiParam.apiDesc: specifies the text to which this operation applies; if null, the operation applies to the current selection.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Deletes a range of text.

apiParam.apiDesc: a FlowOperation object

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Executes a FlowOperation.
The doOperation() method is called by IEditManager functions that update the text flow. You do not typically need to call this function directly unless you create your own custom operations.
This function proceeds in the following steps:
Flush any pending operations before performing this operation.
Send a cancelable flowOperationBegin event. If canceled this method returns immediately.
Execute the operation. The operation returns true or false. False indicates that no changes were made.
Push the operation onto the undo stack.
Clear the redo stack.
Update the display.
Send a cancelable flowOperationEnd event.
Exception handling: If the operation throws an exception, it is caught and the error is attached to the flowOperationEnd event. If the event is not canceled the error is rethrown.

Ends a group of operations.
All operations executed since the last call to beginCompositeOperation() are grouped as a CompositeOperation that is then completed. This CompositeOperation object is added to the undo stack or, if this composite operation is nested inside another composite operation, added to the parent operation.

apiParam.apiDesc: can be either a String interpreted as a uri, a Class interpreted as the class of an Embed DisplayObject, a DisplayObject instance or a URLRequest.
width of the image to insert (number, percent, or 'auto')
height of the image to insert (number, percent, or 'auto')
none supported.
specifies the text to which this operation applies; if null, the operation applies to the current selection.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Inserts an image.
The source of the image can be a string containing a URI, URLRequest object, a Class object representing an embedded asset, or a DisplayObject instance.
The width and height values can be the number of pixels, a percent, or the string, 'auto', in which case the actual dimension of the graphic is used.
Set the float to one of the constants defined in the Float class to specify whether the image should be displayed to the left or right of any text or inline with the text.

apiParam.apiDesc: the string to insert
specifies the text in the flow to which this operation applies; if null, the operation applies to the current selection.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Inserts text.
Inserts the text at a position or range in the text. If the location supplied in the operationState parameter is a range (or the parameter is null and the current selection is a range), then the text currently in the range is replaced by the inserted text.

apiParam.apiDesc: can be either a String interpreted as a uri, a Class interpreted as the class of an Embed DisplayObject, a DisplayObject instance or a URLRequest.
new width for the image (number or percent)
new height for the image (number or percent)
none supported
specifies the text to which this operation applies; if null, the operation applies to the current selection.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Modifies an existing inline graphic.
Set unchanging properties to the values in the original graphic. (Modifying an existing graphic object is typically more efficient than deleting and recreating one.)

apiParam.apiDesc: the string to insert
specifies the text to which this operation applies; if null, the operation applies to the current selection.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Overwrites the selected text.
If the selection is a point selection, the first character is overwritten by the new text.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Pastes the TextScrap into the selected area.

apiParam.apiDesc: the TextScrap to paste
specifies the text to which this operation applies; if null, the operation applies to the current selection.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Pastes the TextScrap into the selected area.
If a range of text is specified, the text in the range is deleted.

Reperforms the previous undone operation.
Note: If the IUndoManager associated with this IEditManager is also associated with another IEditManager, then it is possible that the redo operation associated with the other IEditManager is the one redone. This can happen if the FlowOperation of another IEditManager is on top of the redo stack.
This function does nothing if undo is not turned on.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Splits the paragraph at the current position.

apiParam.apiDesc: specifies the text to which this operation applies; if null, the operation applies to the current selection.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Splits the paragraph at the current position.
If a range of text is specified, the text in the range is deleted.

Reverses the previous operation.
Note: If the IUndoManager associated with this IEditManager is also associated with another IEditManager, then it is possible that the undo operation associated with the other IEditManager is the one undone. This can happen if the FlowOperation of another IEditManager is on top of the undo stack.
This function does nothing if undo is not turned on.

apiValue.shortdesc: The UndoManager object assigned to this EditManager instance, if there is one.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc:
The UndoManager object assigned to this EditManager instance, if there is one.
An undo manager handles undo and redo operations.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: The ISelectionManager interface defines the interface for handling text selection.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc:
The ISelectionManager interface defines the interface for handling text selection.
A SelectionManager keeps track of the selected text range and handles events for a TextFlow.
A selection can be either a point selection or a range selection. A point selection is the insertion point and is indicated visually by drawing a cursor. A range selection includes the text between an anchor point and an active point.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Executes any pending FlowOperations.
The execution of some editing operations, such as text insertion, is delayed until the next enterFrame event. Calling flushPendingOperations() causes any deferred operations to be executed immediately.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Gets the character format attributes that are common to all characters in the specified text range or current selection.

apiParam.apiDesc: The optional range of text for which common attributes are requested. If null, the current selection is used.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Gets the character format attributes that are common to all characters in the specified text range or current selection.
Format attributes that do not have the same value for all characters in the specified element range or selection are set to null in the returned ITextLayoutFormat instance.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Gets the container format attributes that are common to all containers in the specified text range or current selection.

apiParam.apiDesc: The optional range of text for which common attributes are requested. If null, the current selection is used.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Gets the container format attributes that are common to all containers in the specified text range or current selection.
Format attributes that do not have the same value for all containers in the specified element range or selection are set to null in the returned ITextLayoutFormat instance.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Gets the paragraph format attributes that are common to all paragraphs in the specified text range or current selection.

apiParam.apiDesc: The optional range of text for which common attributes are requested. If null, the current selection is used.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Gets the paragraph format attributes that are common to all paragraphs in the specified text range or current selection.
Format attributes that do not have the same value for all paragraphs in the specified element range or selection are set to null in the returned ITextLayoutFormat instance.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Gets the SelectionState object of the current selection.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Gets the SelectionState object of the current selection.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Indicates whether there is a selection.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Indicates whether there is a selection.
Returns true if there is either a range selection or a point selection. By default, when a selection manager is first set up, there is no selection (the start and end are -1).

apiOperation.shortdesc: Indicates whether the selection covers a range of text.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Indicates whether the selection covers a range of text.
Returns true if there is a selection that extends past a single position.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Updates the selection manager when text is inserted or deleted.

apiParam.apiDesc: The point in the text where the change was made.
A positive or negative number indicating how many characters were inserted or deleted.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Updates the selection manager when text is inserted or deleted.
Operations must call notifyInsertOrDelete when changing the text in the text flow. The selection manager adjusts index-based position indicators accordingly. If you create a new Operation class that changes text in a text flow directly (not using another operation) your operation must call this function to keep the selection up to date.

Redisplays the selection shapes.
Note: You do not need to call this method directly. It is called automatically.
Selects the entire flow

apiParam.apiDesc: The anchor point for the new selection, as an absolute position in the TextFlow
The active end of the new selection, as an absolute position in the TextFlow

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Selects a range of text.
If a negative number is passed as either of the parameters, then any existing selection is removed.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Gives the focus to the first container in the selection.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Gives the focus to the first container in the selection.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Sets the SelectionState object of the current selection.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Sets the SelectionState object of the current selection.

apiValue.shortdesc: The text position of the end of the selection, as an offset from the start of the text flow.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc:
The text position of the end of the selection, as an offset from the start of the text flow.
The absolute end is the same as either the active or the anchor point of the selection, whichever comes last in the text flow.

apiValue.shortdesc: The text position of the start of the selection, as an offset from the start of the text flow.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc:
The text position of the start of the selection, as an offset from the start of the text flow.
The absolute start is the same as either the active or the anchor point of the selection, whichever comes first in the text flow.

apiValue.shortdesc: The active point of the selection.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc:
The active point of the selection.
The active point is the volatile end of the selection. The active point is changed when the selection is modified. The active point can be at either the beginning or the end of the selection.

apiValue.shortdesc: The anchor point of the selection.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc:
The anchor point of the selection.
An anchor point is the stable end of the selection. When the selection is extended, the anchor point does not change. The anchor point can be at either the beginning or the end of the selection.

apiValue.shortdesc: The current SelectionFormat object.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc:
The current SelectionFormat object.
The current SelectionFormat object is chosen from the SelectionFormat objects assigned to the unfocusedSelectionFormat, inactiveSelectionFormat and focusedSelectionFormat properties based on the current state of the windowActive and focused properties.

apiValue.shortdesc: The editing mode.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc:
The editing mode.
The editing mode indicates whether the text flow supports selection, editing, or only reading. A text flow is made selectable by assigning a selection manager and editable by assigning an edit manager. Constants representing the editing modes are defined in the EditingMode class.

apiValue.shortdesc: The SelectionFormat object used to draw the selection in a focused container.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The SelectionFormat object used to draw the selection in a focused container.

apiValue.shortdesc: Indicates whether a container in the text flow has the focus.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc:
Indicates whether a container in the text flow has the focus.
The focused property is true if any of the containers in the text flow has key focus.

apiValue.shortdesc: The SelectionFormat object used to draw the selection when it is not in the active window.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The SelectionFormat object used to draw the selection when it is not in the active window.

apiValue.shortdesc: The TextFlow object managed by this selection manager.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc:
The TextFlow object managed by this selection manager.
A selection manager manages a single text flow. A selection manager can also be assigned to a text flow by setting the interactionManager property of the TextFlow object.

apiValue.shortdesc: The SelectionFormat object used to draw the selection when it is not in a focused container, but is in the active window.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The SelectionFormat object used to draw the selection when it is not in a focused container, but is in the active window.

apiValue.shortdesc: Indicates whether the window associated with the text flow is active.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc:
Indicates whether the window associated with the text flow is active.
The windowActive property is true if the window displaying with the text flow is the active window.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: The EditManager class manages editing changes to a TextFlow.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc:
The EditManager class manages editing changes to a TextFlow.
To enable text flow editing, assign an EditManager object to the interactionManager property of the TextFlow object. The edit manager handles changes to the text (such as insertions, deletions, and format changes). Changes are reversible if the edit manager has an undo manager. The edit manager triggers the recomposition and display of the text flow, as necessary.
The EditManager class supports the following keyboard shortcuts:
KeysResult
ctrl-zundo
ctrl-yredo
ctrl-backspacedeletePreviousWord
ctrl-deletedeleteNextWord
alt+deletedeleteNextWord
ctrl+alt-deletedeleteNextWord
ctrl-shift-hypheninsert discretionary hyphen
ctrl+backspacedeletePreviousWord
alt+backspacedeletePreviousWord
ctrl+alt-backspacedeletePreviousWord
INSERTtoggles overWriteMode
backspacedeletePreviousCharacter
ENTERif textFlow.configuration.manageEnterKey splitParagraph
TABif textFlow.configuration.manageTabKey insert a TAB or overwrite next character with a TAB
Note: The following keys do not work on Windows: alt-backspace, alt-delete, ctrl+alt-backspace, and ctrl+alt-delete. These keys do not generate an event for the runtime.

apiParam.apiDesc: The UndoManager for the application

apiConstructorDetail.apiDesc:
Creates an EditManager object.
Assign an EditManager object to the interactionManager property of a text flow to enable editing of that text flow.
To enable support for undoing and redoing changes, pass an IUndoManager instance to the EditManager constructor. You can use the flashx.undo.UndoManager class or create a custom IUndoManager instance. Use a custom IUndoManager instance to integrate Text Layout Framework changes with an existing undo manager that is not an instance of the UndoManager class. To create a custom IUndoManager instance, ensure that the class you use to define the undo manager implements the IUndoManager interface.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Update the display after an operation has modified it

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Update the display after an operation has modified it

apiValue.shortdesc: Indicates whether overwrite mode is on or off.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc:
Indicates whether overwrite mode is on or off.
If true, then a keystroke overwrites the character following the cursor. If false, then a keystroke is inserted at the cursor location.

apiValue.shortdesc: The IUndoManager assigned to this edit manager.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc:
The IUndoManager assigned to this edit manager.
To allow edits to be undone (and redone), pass an IUndoManager instance to the EditManager constructor. The undo manager maintains a stack of operations that have been executed, and it can undo or redo individual operations.
Note: If the TextFlow is modified directly (not via calls to the EditManager, but directly via calls to the managed FlowElement objects), then the EditManager clears the undo stack to prevent the stack from getting out of sync with the current state.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: The IInteractionEventHandler interface defines the event handler functions that are handled by a Text Layout Framework selection or edit manager.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: The IInteractionEventHandler interface defines the event handler functions that are handled by a Text Layout Framework selection or edit manager.

Edit events are dispatched for cut, copy, paste, and selectAll commands.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: The SelectionFormat class defines the properties of a selection highlight.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: The SelectionFormat class defines the properties of a selection highlight.

apiConstructor.shortdesc: Creates a SelectionFormat object with the specified properties.

apiParam.apiDesc: The color for drawing the highlight.
The transparency value for drawing the highlight. Valid values are between 0 (completely transparent) and 1 (completely opaque, which is the default).
The blend mode for drawing the highlight. Use constants defined in the BlendMode class to set this parameter.
The color for the drawing cursor.
The transparency value for drawing the cursor. Valid values are between 0 (completely transparent) and 1 (completely opaque, which is the default).
The blend mode for drawing the cursor. Use constants defined in the BlendMode class to set this parameter.
The rate at which the cursor blinks, in milliseconds.

apiConstructorDetail.apiDesc:
Creates a SelectionFormat object with the specified properties.
A SelectionFormat created with the default values will use black for the highlight colors, 1.0 for the alphas, and BlendMode.DIFFERENCE for the blending modes. The cursor blink rate is 500 milliseconds.
Setting the pointAlpha and rangeAlpha properties to zero disables selection highlighting.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Determines whether this SelectionFormat object has the same property values as another SelectionFormat object.

apiReturn.apiDesc: true, if the property values are identical; false, otherwise.

apiParam.apiDesc: the SelectionFormat to compare against.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Determines whether this SelectionFormat object has the same property values as another SelectionFormat object.

apiValue.shortdesc: The alpha for drawing the cursor.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc:
The alpha for drawing the cursor. Valid values are between 0 (completely transparent) and 1 (completely opaque, which is the default).
Setting the pointAlpha and rangeAlpha properties to zero disables selection highlighting.

apiValue.shortdesc: The blend mode for drawing the cursor.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The blend mode for drawing the cursor.

apiValue.shortdesc: The rate at which the cursor blinks, in milliseconds.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The rate at which the cursor blinks, in milliseconds.

apiValue.shortdesc: The color for drawing the cursor.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The color for drawing the cursor.

apiValue.shortdesc: The alpha for drawing the highlight of a range selection.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc:
The alpha for drawing the highlight of a range selection. Valid values are between 0 (completely transparent) and 1 (completely opaque, which is the default).
Setting the pointAlpha and rangeAlpha properties to zero disables selection highlighting.

apiValue.shortdesc: The blending mode for drawing the highlight of a range selection.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The blending mode for drawing the highlight of a range selection.

apiValue.shortdesc: The color for drawing the highlight of a range selection.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The color for drawing the highlight of a range selection.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: The TextClipboard class copies and pastes TextScrap objects to and from the system clipboard.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc:
The TextClipboard class copies and pastes TextScrap objects to and from the system clipboard.
When you copy a TextScrap to the TextClipboard, the information is copied to the system clipboard in two clipboard formats. One format is an XML string expressing the copied TextScrap object in Text Layout Markup syntax. This clipboard object uses the format name: "TEXT_LAYOUT_MARKUP". The second format is a plain-text string, which uses the standard Clipboard.TEXT_FORMAT name.
The methods of the TextClipboard class are static functions, you do not need to create an instance of TextClipboard.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Gets any text on the system clipboard as a TextScrap object.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Gets any text on the system clipboard as a TextScrap object.
If the "TEXT_LAYOUT_MARKUP" format is available, this method converts the formatted string into a TextScrap and returns it. Otherwise, if the Clipboard.TEXT_Format is available, this method converts the plain-text string into a TextScrap. If neither clipboard format is available, this method returns null.
Flash Player requires that the getContents() method be called in a paste event handler. In AIR, this restriction only applies to content outside of the application security sandbox.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Puts a TextScrap onto the system clipboard.

apiParam.apiDesc: The TextScrap to paste into the clipboard.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Puts a TextScrap onto the system clipboard.
The TextScrap is placed onto the system clipboard as both a Text Layout Markup representation and a plain text representation.
Flash Player requires a user event (such as a key press or mouse click) before calling setContents(). In AIR, this restriction only applies to content outside of the application security sandbox.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: The EditingMode class defines constants used with EditManager class to represent the read, select, and edit permissions of a document.

apiClassifierDetail.apiDesc: The EditingMode class defines constants used with EditManager class to represent the read, select, and edit permissions of a document.

apiValue.shortdesc: The document is read-only.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc:
The document is read-only.
Neither selection nor editing is allowed.

apiValue.shortdesc: The text in the document can be selected and copied, but not edited.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The text in the document can be selected and copied, but not edited.

apiValue.shortdesc: The document can be edited.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: The document can be edited.
